Splitwise is useful, especially for groups of 3 or more, for tracking and evenly dividing group expenses, making it easier for all to equally share & pay group expenditures.

What could be better:

1. Navigating within the app. The current layout & menus can be confusing.

2. Make it possible/easier to permanently erase individual transactions, groups of transactions, and group or entire histories from one's account.  Legacy info can "bleed into " more recent activity & throw off calculations, making the app ineffective at its main job.

3. Offer users an option to permanently delete their account, & permanently erase ALL data associated with it.

Review Title: A must for splitting expenses with roommates! üö©Can‚Äôt itemize existing photo or use iPad splitscreen
Review Text:
The only things missing the ability to work in split screen on an iPad Air M2, and itemize a receipt from an existing photo. Other than that, this app has everything I need! It works really well. Alot of thought and polish has gone into it. 

Paying for premium is 100% worth it since my roommates and I need to split a lot of group purchases. With the paid version you can automatically (with little need for manual corrections) itemize a paper receipt. The only problem is you have to take a picture, you can‚Äôt use the auto itemize feature if the receipt forms from an existing photo. To do that I have to pull the photo up on another screen and use the Splitwise app to take a picture of the picture of the receipt. It seems like a glaring lack when the rest of the app is so polished. Splitwise makes it really easy to carve up any receipt, you can choose how to split it by item, by different percentages for each person, or just manually enter amounts everyone owes.

The only other feature I want added is the ability to work in split screen on an iPad. Right now I have to pull Splitwise up on my phone and set it next to my iPad when I want to review my budget, until I can put Splitwise in split screen then I‚Äôll need two devices to manage my finances. Switching back and forth over and over between apps just to review my finances doesn‚Äôt work well for me.

Review Text:
I love the app, the UI, and everything about it‚Ä¶ until recently. They started with a Pro subscription model and have gradually been putting previously free features behind a paywall. Sound familiar? Find an alternative rather than getting started with Splitwise.

Why not add new features that will make your users want to pay, rather than forcing them by removing previously free features?

Now I‚Äôm limited to a few transactions a day, and for some of those I can add, I have to wait on a 10 sec ad before I can add them.
Really only 3 expenses per day.
Not user friendly
The best way to track and split expenses whether it‚Äôs just between you and 1 friend, your spouse or a huge group! Must have for a trip or everyday tracking!

This works well for dividing expenses, but I have been trying for days to receive the $ I was paid, and have been unable to transfer to my bank account.  I think I may eventually have to pay the fee to get the $ out. Seems like a scam.
Use the app for years. Simple, easy, straightforward. Save tons of time!

In order to get repaid for a split expense, Splitwise is saying that the payment is incomplete on the other side but it was clearly taken out of the other person‚Äôs account 5 days ago and hung up somewhere. In order to contact anyone to get this resolved the app says I need to email them? C‚Äômon. Get with the 21st century and update your processes. Never again will I use your garbage app.
Great app for a group trip. Absolute essential
It‚Äôs good.  It‚Äôs a calculator.  It allows larger groups to split costs.  And is tied to payment apps (Venmo).  We like very much.

Review Title: You have to pay for pro version
Review Text: Otherwise you will limited to only a item and in such case I can calculate everything manually.
Very weak on directions. For instance, how do I correct an entry or cancel an entry??
You can only add 4 expenses using free version which renders this app useless
That's all there is to it. Love it.

This app used to be amazing. Now there‚Äôs limits on the number of items you can add in a day unless you pay a subscription. Website says it‚Äôs to prevent fraud which is a lame excuse. Will be looking for alternatives or going back to spreadsheets.

Review Title: Not useful if you‚Äôre not paying for a subscription
Review Text: It‚Äôs so unfortunate that you have to pay to use Splitwise now. You can‚Äôt add more than 5 expenses per day unless you have Pro. It‚Äôs not that I can‚Äôt afford it but it‚Äôs such a disappointment that it fell into one of those companies that value profit over users. Some alt apps I suggest is Settle Up or Splid. You can also use the Notion app and find a free budgeting template to split stuff.

It is absolutely ridiculous and unacceptable how long it takes to recover your money if a payer decides to use Splitwise Pay to settle up.  You have to wait 2-3 days until it is available to send to your account and then a full week if you‚Äôre exceeded $2k in one week.  This is a terrible experience and one I‚Äôll never use again!
Makes it so easy when traveling in a group to settle up Who owes who how much.
Don‚Äôt use this. Use a different app. Setup takes forever. Very inconvenient setting up payment.

Review Title: Rent for splitting expenses, terrible for transferring money
Review Text:
This app is awesome for tracking all of travel expenses, when traveling with different groups and trying to settle up. I will use it for that function on every trip.

Settling up within the app however is terrible. Someone tried to pay me over $5000 and they were limited to $2000. The funds were not available to me for almost a week and then the maximum amount I could move to my bank account is $800. It is much easier & faster to use other payment methods to settle up.
Trash

Review Title: It is getting worse day by day
Review Text: Don‚Äôt waste your time on this pathetic app

Review Title: Overall pretty darn good - please update reoccurring items process
Review Text: Overall pretty darn good - please update reoccurring items process to make it so reoccurring items appear at the beginning of the day they are scheduled. Right now it seems the reoccurring items appear on the scheduled day BUT NOT at the beginning of that day, instead they appear throughout the day - possibly at the create timestamp? Makes it so we have to wait a whole day or two for everything to complete for the reoccurring items. This update would take it to 5 stars for us! A few more features: could make it 5+ stars :) will share those ideas if interested.

Review Title: Takes forever for money to transfer
Review Text: I have been waiting for the money to just transfer into my splitwise account (not even into my bank account) for 4 days and it‚Äôs still pending. This is ridiculous. Should have used Venmo. I don‚Äôt recommend using this app for payments.
I‚Äôve been using Splitwise for several years, and I can‚Äôt recommend it enough. It makes traveling with groups so much easier.
My goodness what a mess

My sisters and I have used Splitwise for years and loved it. Now it forces you to watch add to upgrade to Splitwise Pro w every expense added and you can only add 5 expenses per day. Searching for new app.

Review Title: The greedy creeps now limit entries to 3 per day.
Review Text: This was a handy App when traveling with others. Now it‚Äôs pretty much useless unless you pay $4.99 per month. Insane for casual travelers.

Review Title: Was a great app, not anymore
Review Text: I use to love using Splitwise with my friends for trips. But now the app is filled with ads to upgrade to ‚ÄúSplitwise pro‚Äù after every single expense entry. Literally every single time you add a expense there is a SIX SECOND ad that pops up that you can‚Äôt bypass or the six seconds restarts again. And after four expense entries you reach the max limit of daily expense entries unless‚Ä¶ you guessed it. Unless you upgrade to Splitwise pro. The old Splitwise pro had all unlimited entries and no adds for the free version. Corporate greed has ruined something really handy. Now I‚Äôm going to delete the app and use google sheets or just my good old note pad and calculator.
They‚Äôve figured out how to monetize. Don‚Äôt bother learning unless you‚Äôre prepared to pay the subscription. Apparently Venmo is free

I understand need to monetize but only 4 expenses a day without paying 5$ a month makes this way less attractive. I would not use any other pro feature and for 5$ can pay someone on 5er to make a workable excel (can make it myself too). 

An ad or two would be fine, if annoying but 4/day max without upgrading to a full set of other unneeded features for too much money is a huge product degradation
this app could be great but the second you find a use for it, it demands you pay. such a shame

Review Title: People can pay accounts that don‚Äôt exist
Review Text:
Someone in my party paid me via paypal and I don‚Äôt have a paypal. So the payment went to my email and I have to create a paypal to access it. 

You cannot restrict how people pay you. If someone pays on splitwise then it will go to your email registered with splitwise and you will have to create a paypal/venmo or ask the payer to delete the payment. You also can‚Äôt direct splitwise to a specific paypal/venmo account, it goes to whatever email is on splitwise. If you don‚Äôt use 1 email for everything this creates issues.
Reduce the premium price
Like mostly everything but way way too complicated to delete a group . Please make it easier .

Overall the functionality is great. 5 families on a ski trip used it to reconcile expenses. But would be nice if we could group direct family members (as a single entity) for payment reconciliation. 
My wife and I both owing the same person should be consolidated. 
Or if someone owes me $500 but my wife owes someone else $500, that $ shouldn‚Äôt go through us.

Extremely expensive for what it offers. I‚Äôm not sure how they think they‚Äôll be successful at such a cost for a glorified excel sheet.

It should go down in the books  as a prime case of how to alienate your customer base.

I wrongly assumed this app would just help you split up a single event. Not so! You can keep track of all the things you do with multiple friends, and it nets them all  out and makes it easy to say ‚ÄúI‚Äôll get the next one‚Äù without worrying you will at the end of the day pay way too much or too little.
